Funding will be cut off unless Republicans and Democrats can agree a way forward on a spending bill.

title: Warriors, Kuminga End Stalemate with $48.5M Two-Year Deal
snippets: Jonathan Kuminga and the Warriors ended a monthslong stalemate Tuesday, reaching agreement on a two-year deal worth $48.5 million.
The Kuminga contract saga is finally over
The Warriors went up a little in money and Kuminga accepted the team option on the second year, making a trade more likely.
Golden State and the forward come together after a long and public negotiation
Jonathan Kuminga and the Warriors have finally reached agreement on a deal, ESPN reports. A look at the contract and what it means.
Restricted free agent forward Jonathan Kuminga has signed a two-year, $48.5 million contract to return to the Golden State Warriors, ESPN’s Shams Charania reported Tuesday.
titles: Kuminga, Warriors end stalemate with 2-year deal
Jonathan Kuminga, Warriors end contract standoff as forward signs two-year deal with Golden State, per report
Stalemate over: Jonathan Kuminga, Warriors reportedly agree to two-year, $48.5 million contract extension
Warriors, Kuminga Agree On Two-Year $48M Deal
Warriors, Jonathan Kuminga reach agreement on new contract, per report: What it means
Report: Jonathan Kuminga signs two-year, $48.5M contract with Warriors
summary: Jonathan Kuminga and the Golden State Warriors have ended a prolonged negotiation by agreeing to a two-year contract worth $48.5 million. The deal, which includes a team option for the second year, was finalized after the Warriors increased their financial offer. This resolution comes after a public and extended stalemate between the forward and the team.

title: Ex-Congo President Kabila Sentenced to Death in Absentia for Multiple Crimes
snippets: Joseph Kabila is accused of supporting the M23, but he denies having any involvement with the rebel group.
Head of military tribunal says Kabila convicted of several crimes, including treason, murder and torture.
Former Congolese President Joseph Kabila was sentenced to death in absentia by a military court. He was found guilty of treason and complicity with the M23 militia.

Military court convicts Kabila of war crimes, treason and other offences in verdict that could fuel enduring tensions

A military court in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has sentenced the country’s former president Joseph Kabila to death in absentia after convicting him of war crimes,
Joseph Kabila, who was president of the Democratic Republic of Congo for 18 years, was convicted of treason by a court in Kinshasa.
titles: Former Congolese president sentenced to death for war crimes
DR Congo’s ex-President Joseph Kabila sentenced to death in absentia
Congo: Death sentence for former leader Joseph Kabila
Former DRC president Joseph Kabila sentenced to death in absentia
Congo’s Former President Sentenced to Death in Absentia
summary: Former Congolese President Joseph Kabila was sentenced to death in absentia by a military court in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. He was convicted of several crimes, including treason, murder, torture, and complicity with the M23 militia. This verdict comes after Kabila's 18-year presidency and could escalate tensions in the region.

title: UN Security Council Votes to Expand Haiti Mission with 5,500 Troops
snippets: International mission would surge personnel in Haiti, with mandate to 'neutralise, isolate, and deter' gangs.

Unit will have up to 5,500 soldiers and police officers who will tackle the violence that has overwhelmed the country

The United Nations has adopted a resolution to transform a security mission in gang-dominated Haiti into a larger, fully fledged force with military troops.

The new un
The Security Council vote was an acknowledgment that the police mission it once backed had failed to wrest back control of the beleaguered Caribbean nation.
The vote on Tuesday would establish a force of up to 5,500 soldiers and police officers. It was unclear what countries were willing to contribute personnel or money.
titles: UN Security Council approves ‘Gang Suppression Force’ for Haiti
UN security council approves new military force to fight Haiti gangs
U.N. approves militarized force to take on Haiti’s gangs
U.N. Security Council Approves Larger Force to Fight Gangs in Haiti
summary: The United Nations Security Council has voted to expand a security mission in Haiti into a larger force with up to 5,500 soldiers and police officers. This decision aims to neutralize, isolate, and deter gangs that have overwhelmed the country. The move acknowledges the failure of the previous police mission to control the situation in Haiti. However, the contributing countries and funding details remain unspecified.

title: Trump Administration Strikes Deal to Lower U.S. Drug Prices

summary: The Trump administration announced a deal with Pfizer and other drugmakers aimed at lowering U.S. drug prices. Details on how the initiative will work are unclear, but it follows Trump's letters to 17 drug companies urging price reductions by Sept. 29. The outcome or effectiveness of this agreement remains unspecified.

title: Scientists Develop Technique to Create Eggs from Skin Cells for Infertility Trea
snippets: Scientists created the eggs using DNA from adult skin cells, a step that could someday potentially lead to new ways to treat infertility and enable gay couples to have genetically related children.
US scientists testing the technique say it could help people overcome infertility and potentially allow same-sex couples to have a genetically related child.
An innovative use of skin cells could provide a route for gay couples or women with fertility problems to have children they are both genetically related to
The embryos weren’t used to try to establish a pregnancy, but the researchers behind the technique say it could one day be used to address infertility.
titles: Scientists create human eggs in the lab, using skin cells
Scientists make embryos from human skin DNA for first time
Egg cells made with DNA from human skin fertilised in the lab
Scientists Made Human Eggs From Skin Cells and Used Them to Form Embryos
summary: Scientists have developed a technique to create eggs from the DNA of adult skin cells, offering a potential future treatment for infertility. This method could also enable gay couples to have genetically related children. However, the embryos created were not used to attempt pregnancy. The researchers believe this approach could one day help address infertility issues.

title: South African Ambassador to France Found Dead in Paris
snippets: The circumstances around Nathi Mthethwa's death are being investigated by the French authorities.
South African Ambassador Nkosinathi Emmanuel "Nathi" Mthethwa was found dead outside of a high-rise hotel in Paris.
Ambassador Nkosinathi Emmanuel "Nathi" Mthethwa's body was discovered outside a Paris hotel. His death is being treated as a possible suicide, the local presecutor's office says.
The police are investigating the death of the ambassador, Nkosinathi Emmanuel Mthethwa, as a possible suicide.
titles: South Africa's top diplomat in France found dead near Paris hotel
South African Ambassador to France found dead outside Paris hotel
South Africa's ambassador to France found dead in Paris
South African Ambassador to France Is Found Dead in Paris
summary: South African Ambassador Nkosinathi Emmanuel "Nathi" Mthethwa was found dead outside a high-rise hotel in Paris. French authorities are investigating the circumstances of his death, with police considering it a possible suicide.

The couple, married in 2006, had reportedly been living apart since the beginning of summer. This development has surprised many of their fans.

title: Trump, Netanyahu Agree on Gaza Peace Deal; Hamas Approval Pending
snippets: Details are key in any peace agreement. Donald Trump’s 20-point plan for Gaza is notably lacking in them.
The Israeli premier’s reluctance to fully withdraw troops or make way for a Palestinian state, combined with Hamas’s reluctance to disarm, may result in a fragile deal, analysts say.

It would end the war and secure the release of all hostages. Hamas would give up its arms and its power, while a transitional government is set up. Hamas has not agreed and the terms will be hard for it to swallow.
titles: Trump’s Gaza peace plan has 20 points but few details
Netanyahu tries to sell Trump’s Gaza peace plan to a skeptical right wing
Trump’s Gaza Plan: What We Know
summary: US President Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu have agreed on a new Gaza peace deal, lacking detailed information. The deal aims to end the war and secure the release of all hostages by having Hamas disarm and relinquish power for a transitional government. However, challenges arise from Netanyahu's reluctance to withdraw troops or allow a Palestinian state, and Hamas's hesitation to disarm. The outcome remains uncertain as Hamas has yet to agree to the terms.

summary: Approximately 750,000 federal workers are at risk of furloughs due to a potential government shutdown. Despite the risk, some federal employees are indifferent to the possibility of a shutdown. The shutdown could also freeze the IPO market. Democrats are demanding that any temporary funding measure to prevent the shutdown includes an extension of enhanced Affordable Care Act tax credits set to expire at the end of 2025. Federal workers were notified via email about the potential furloughs associated with the shutdown.

title: Deepti Sharma Leads India to Win Over Sri Lanka in World Cup Opener
snippets: Watch highlights from a rain-affected opening game of the Women's World Cup as India fight back following a middle-order collapse to defeat Sri Lanka by 59 runs.

• India, 269-8, beat Sri Lanka, 211, by 59 runs (DLS)

  • Sharma scores 53 and takes three wickets in Guwahati

Deepti Sharma impressed with bat and ball as India defeat fellow co-hosts Sri Lanka by 59 runs (Duckworth-Lewis-Stern method) in the rain-affected openin
Amanjot Kaur scored her maiden Women's Cricket World Cup half-century as India began their campaign with a 59-run victory (DLS Method) over Sri Lanka in a rain-affected opening encounter in Guwahati.
titles: India secure opening-day World Cup win over Sri Lanka
Deepti Sharma leads India rally to deny Sri Lanka in Cricket World Cup opener
Amanjot impresses as India beat Sri Lanka in rain-affected World Cup opener
summary: Deepti Sharma starred with a half-century and three wickets, leading India to a 59-run victory over Sri Lanka under the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern method in the rain-affected Women's World Cup opener in Guwahati. Amanjot Kaur also scored her maiden World Cup half-century, contributing to India's total of 269-8 before restricting Sri Lanka to 211.

title: Truck Overturns Near Whatcom Road Exit, No Injuries Reported

The driver was caught attempting to turn the wrong way on Isabella Street shortly after 4 a.m. Tuesday.

Wrong-way driver charged with impaired driving in downtown Ottawa
summary: A truck overturned near the Whatcom Road exit just after 8 p.m., spilling its load onto the road. Police confirmed there were no injuries. Separately, the driver was caught making an illegal turn on Isabella Street around 4 a.m. Tuesday.

title: Lynx's Collier Criticizes WNBA Leadership and Officiating
snippets: Lynx star Napheesa Collier said the WNBA has the "worst leadership" and accused commissioner Cathy Engelbert of being "negligent" in her governance.
Minnesota Lynx superstar Napheesa Collier delivers a statement on the state of the WNBA, calling out league officials for allowing poor officiating and failing to do right by its players.
Minnesota Lynx star Napheesa Collier is joining her coach in raising alarm bells about the state of the WNBA.
titles: Collier blasts WNBA's Engelbert: 'Worst leadership'
Collier sounds off on WNBA brass: ‘Worst leadership in the world’
Lynx star Napheesa Collier on WNBA: ‘Worst leadership in the world’
summary: Napheesa Collier, a star player for the Minnesota Lynx, criticized the WNBA's leadership, specifically targeting Commissioner Cathy Engelbert for negligence. Collier accused the league of poor officiating and not adequately supporting its players, aligning her concerns with her coach's previous statements about the league's governance issues.

summary: LeBron James missed the Lakers' opening training camp on Tuesday due to nerve irritation in his glute. Despite not practicing, the team plans for him to be ready for the season's opening night.

snippets: Maresca's Chelsea beat Mourinho's Benfica in the Champions League, but the reception from fans made it clear which manager is revered.
Chelsea collected their first win of the Champions League league phase as they beat former manager Jose Mourinho's Benfica 1-0 at Stamford Bridge.

title: Tigers Beat Guardians 2-1 in AL Wild Card Series Opener, Skubal Strikes 14
snippets: Two unearned runs scored on costly errors, costing the Cleveland Guardians a loss against the Detroit Tigers.
Tarik Skubal tied Detroit’s post-season record with 14 strikeouts and the Tigers beat the Cleveland Guardians 2-1 on Tuesday in Game 1 of their AL Wild Card Series.
titles: Detroit Tigers Take Cleveland Guardians Game One Of Wild Card Series
Tarik Skubal fans 14 as Tigers top Guardians in Game 1 of wild-card series
summary: In Game 1 of their AL Wild Card Series, the Detroit Tigers defeated the Cleveland Guardians 2-1, largely due to two unearned runs resulting from costly errors by the Guardians. Tarik Skubal of the Tigers tied the team's post-season record with 14 strikeouts during the game.
